items.message: A heads-up on Kay Kennedy's November 4th show, "Tumble Dry," during the November Art Crawl at Watkins's new gallery at the Packing Plant. https://t.co/tNHaO1c1TP
items.unformatted_message: A heads-up on Kay Kennedy's November 4th show, "Tumble Dry," during the November Art Crawl at Watkins's new gallery at the Packing Plant. https://t.co/tNHaO1c1TP

items.message: A heads-up on Kay Kennedy's November 4th show during the November Art Crawl at Watkins's new gallery at the Packing Plant. The event features "Tumble Dry," a performance piece by Kennedy, an interdisciplinary artist living in Nashville. Kennedy works in a variety of mediums including sculpture, installation, video, and performance. Her pieces are often collaborative and frequently engage a group or community. She received her BFA from Watkins in 2017. In 2016, she co-founded Patchbay, an experimental art and new music program.
items.unformatted_message: A heads-up on Kay Kennedy's November 4th show during the November Art Crawl at Watkins's new gallery at the Packing Plant. The event features "Tumble Dry," a performance piece by Kennedy, an interdisciplinary artist living in Nashville. Kennedy works in a variety of mediums including sculpture, installation, video, and performance. Her pieces are often collaborative and frequently engage a group or community. She received her BFA from Watkins in 2017. In 2016, she co-founded Patchbay, an experimental art and new music program.

items.message:
Opening tomorrow in the Currey Gallery, an exhibit showcasing the work of eight Nashville painters, including Watkins professor Brady Haston. On September 14th, we'll have a panel discussion on the show with Tom Williams, Terry Thacker, and Mark Scala from the Frist Center for the Visual Arts.

http://www.watkins.edu/event/the-shadows-body-paintings-allegorical-impulse/?instance_id=569

items.message: #MondayMotivation from dramatist Alan Ayckbourn "The darker the subject, the more light you must try to shed on the matter. And vice versa."

items.message: A different type of #MondayMotivation for you today: Watkins's YArt Sale. From 2 to 5 PM, all student work priced under $50. Get here fast.

items.message: #MondayMotivation from French dramatist Emile Zola: "The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work."
